intro: Boesenbergia pauciflora var. bullata, commonly known as the Bullate Ginger, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The varietal name "bullata" refers to the swollen, bulb-like appearance of its rhizomes.
